pageContext.claim: “I understand Clapper. He gets a couple of bucks from CNN, and Jeff Zucker and that group of -- that den of thieves over there, they tell him at CNN and MSDNC, they tell him exactly what to say. They say this is what you're going to say or we're not -- we don't want you on the show.”
pageContext.analysis: Networks often hire commentators based on their views, their politics or to give representation to a particular group or perspective, but Trump is speculating wildly and falsely about a media conspiracy that is too far-fetched to take seriously. There's no evidence that media executives are dictating what former government officials say on air about Trump. Clapper and other critics simply disagree with him.
